Managing Server Event Handlers

StarTeamMPX has an event transmitter that must be installed on the same computer as the Server. In addition, you can install StarTeamMPX Services (Message Broker and Multicast Service) on the same or other computers, depending upon your needs. The Cross-Platform client does not support the Multicast protocol.

This discussion explains how to add, modify and delete event handlers. It does not explain the purpose of the properties or the range of values that can be assigned to them. For more information, see the StarTeamMPX Administrator’s Guide.

Note: A server configuration must be running before you can review its configuration options. See Modifying a Server Configuration.

To assign default event handlers for servers and/or clients:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    These actions display the Server Administration dialog.

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using a client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Configure Server shortcut in the lower left pane.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Administration > Configure Server.

    These actions display the Configure Server dialog.

  4. Select the Event Handlers tab.

  5. From the Event Handlers dialog, select an existing event handler.

  6. Do one or both of the following:

    • Click Server Default to make the selected profile the profile for the server. A server icon appears in front of the default server profile.

    • Click Client Default to make the selected profile the default profile for clients. The default profile is indicated by an icon of a computer monitor.

    As users create server descriptions on their workstations, the profile selection defaults to this profile. Users can change from the default to another existing profile. If a profile is both the server and client default, only the server icon appears.

To review or modify an existing event handler:

  1. On a computer that has the Server installed, do one of the following:

    • Select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • Select Tools > Server Administration from the StarTeam client menu.

    These actions display the Server Administration dialog.

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Configure Server shortcut in the lower left pane.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Administration > Configure Server.

    These actions display the Configure Server dialog.

  4. Select the Event Handlers tab.

  5. From the Event Handlers dialog, select an existing event handler.

  6. Click Modify. The Event Handler Profile Properties dialog appears.  

  7. Scroll through the settings. To change a setting:

    1. Select the setting from the Profile properties list box.

    2. Click Modify. The Event Handler Property dialog appears.

    3. Change the value.

    4. Click OK.

  8. To add a property:

    1. Click Add. An empty Event Handler Property dialog appears.

    2. Enter a property name and value in the appropriate check boxes.

    3. Click OK.

  9. To remove a property:

    1. Select a setting from the Profile Properties list box.

    2. Click Remove.

    Note: You cannot delete a profile that is currently used as the default profile.

To create new event handlers:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • Select Tools > Server Administration from the menu bar.

    • Select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > Server Administration.

    The Server Administration dialog appears.

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Configure Server shortcut in the lower left pane.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Administration > Configure Server.

    These actions display the Configure Server dialog.

  4. Select the Event Handlers tab.

  5. From the Event Handlers dialog, select an existing event handler.

  6. To create a brand new event handler:

    1. Click Add. An empty Event Handler Profile Properties dialog appears.

    2. Enter a name and description in the appropriate text boxes.

    3. Click Add to display an empty Event Handler Property dialog.

    4. Enter the property name and its values in the text boxes.

    5. Repeat steps c and d until you have entered all the properties required.

  7. To create a new event handler based on an existing one:

    1. Select an event handler that is similar to the new handler you require.

    2. Click Copy. The Event Handler Profile Properties dialog displays the properties for the existing event handler.

    3. Enter a name and description in the appropriate text boxes.

    4. Select and modify other properties, as appropriate.

To remove an event handler:

  1. On a computer that has the Server installed, do one of the following:

    • Select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • Select Tools > Server Administration from the StarTeam client menu.

    These actions display the Server Administration dialog.

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Configure Server shortcut in the lower left pane.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Administration > Configure Server.

    These actions display the Configure Server dialog.

  4. Select the Event Handlers tab.

  5. From the Event Handlers dialog, select an existing event handler.

  6. Click Remove.
